body: ahold the dutch based supermarket group which already ranks among the 10 largest food retailers in the us is to bolster its position in the south eastern us by acquiring red food stores from promodes the french retailing group red food stores with annual sales of dollars 585m operates 55 grocery stores in eastern tennessee and georgia when the deal is completed in late april it will mark ahold s sixth acquisition of a us supermarket chain since it entered the us market in 1977 the latest purchase will lift its annual us turnover by almost 9 per cent to about fl 7 25bn dollars 3 75bn representing slightly more than half of ahold s total sales ahold declined to give financial details but said the purchase would be financed out of available resources in may the company which has long been seeking a new us acquisition raised roughly fl 450m through a 1 for 10 rights issue away from the us ahold has been concentrating its expansion in recent years on portugal where it has bought several grocery and hypermarket chains and the czech republic where it is slowly building up the mana chain the acquisition of red food stores fits the pattern of ahold s earlier us growth which has relied on buying supermarkets in contiguous regions to promote partnerships between its chains and to spread the dutch company s presence across the eastern us we see new opportunities for synergy benefiting both our customers as well as the bottom line mr robert zwartendijk president of ahold usa said red food stores base in tennessee and georgia is close to that of ahold s bi lo chain which operates 187 supermarkets in georgia north carolina and south carolina ahold s four other us chains cover the eastern us from virginia to massachusetts

title: ft 22 feb 94 international company news bikuben returns to the black but cuts payout
body: bikuben the savings bank has cut its annual dividend to dkr5 from dkr6 a share despite moving back into profit after two years of losses the group made a pre tax profit of dkr193m dollars 28 7m last year compared with a 1992 loss of dkr1 17bn financial income increased to dkr5 54bn from dkr3 67bn and costs were down to dkr2 78bn from dkr2 87bn but after bad debt provisions which rose to dkr2 69bn from dkr1 75bn there was an operating loss of dkr132m against a 1992 loss of dkr1 09bn only extraordinary income of dk325m enabled the savings bank to report a small profit mr borge munk ebbesen chief executive described the result as not satisfactory total assets increased to dkr100m from dkr95m and the group said the capital adequacy ratio was 11 1 per cent compared with the danish minimum level of 9 per cent

title: ft 22 feb 94 international company news daimler benz in swatch car venture talks
body: daimler benz the german engineering group which owns mercedes will discuss today a possible joint venture with smh swiss maker of the swatch watch to develop a small economical car mr roland klein daimler benz spokesman confirmed yesterday that a possible collaboration between the two companies was on the agenda as the company s board meets for its usual tuesday meeting but he warned that no final decision was yet in sight the swatchmobile project has been promoted by mr nicolas hayek smh chairman for several years volkswagen was involved but withdrew in january last year volkswagen said then it was under pressure to cut costs and wanted to avoid the heavy invest ment associated with the project speculation that daimler benz would build the long awaited swatch car has recently increased after mr helmut werner the chairman of mercedes said last week in frankfurt that his company may team up with swatch smh has been talking with various carmakers for about a year the new two seater environmentally friendly small car would be a welcome addition to the mercedes range in the face of increased competition in what is deemed an increasingly important strategic market segment german rival carmaker volkswagen recently announced that its audi subsidiary would build a small car starting in 1996 and bmw is taking control of the british car producer rover which manufactures similar cars nothing has been decided a spokeswoman for swatch said adding that the group would be making no announcement today mr hayek said recently he expected to name a partner this year

title: ft 22 feb 94 international company news spaniards set for record dollars 300m equity placement
body: fomento de construcciones y contratas fcc a leading and highly diversified spanish construction company is to make the largest ever equity placement by a private spanish company the bulk of the placement which could raise more than dollars 300m will be offered to us and uk institutions with goldman sachs the us bank leading the us tranche and co leading the uk and continental europe tranche with schroders of the uk banco central hispano will place a smaller tranche among domestic institutions analysts said fcc s decision could inspire more domestic companies to tap the markets large spanish corporate placements are usually the domain of the public sector the latest being the utility endesa which announced a dollars 1 4bn global offering last weekend some 20 per cent of fcc will be offered to the markets which will raise the amount of its shares that are freely traded to 40 per cent one of the biggest among the domestic construction companies the equity being offered is made up of treasury stock stock owned by fcc s cement subsidiary valderribas and a portion of the 74 per cent shareholding in fcc that is owned by the koplowitz family in addition to its lead management role goldman will act as the global co ordinator of the placement and the design of the global offering private placements on two international tranches one for the us and one for the uk and continental europe and a third tranche for domestic institutions follows closely the pattern that goldman established when it brought repsol the state owned energy group to the market last year the fcc mandate turns spain into one of the us bank s leading profit centres goldman will be advising endesa s global offering which is likely in may and it could also place another portion of repsol equity on the market after the summer fcc is a holding company with divisions covering construction cement property car parks waste management and waste collection and street cleaning it shares the leadership of the domestic construction industry with dragados y construcciones has a 70 per cent quota of the fast growing waste management sector and is the second largest cement company after cemex the mexican producer which acquired large spanish cement companies two years ago

title: ft 22 feb 94 international company news norsk hydro sharply ahead at nkr3bn
body: norsk hydro norway s largest publicly quoted company yesterday reported a sharp increase in 1993 profits helped by lower costs higher crude oil production and the disposal of the group s 38 3 per cent stake in freia marabou the norwegian chocolate producer it also plans to spend between nkr600m and nkr700m on expanding its three pvc plants if the plan is adopted later this year annual production of the raw material s pvc will rise to 400 000 tonnes a year over a four year period from the current figure of 265 000 tonnes european capacity is almost 6m tonnes a year and pvc prices have fared relatively well in a petrochemical sector dogged by overcapacity in europe norsk hydro s net profits in 1993 advanced to nkr3bn dollars 403m including a pre tax gain of nkr2 53bn from the freia disposal from nkr1 8bn in 1992 excluding the gain net profit was nkr1 2bn the board proposed lifting the 1993 dividend to nkr3 50 a share from nkr3 in 1992 group operating profit rose by 37 per cent to nkr4 04bn from nkr3bn as sales increased by nkr4 23n to nkr62 4bn prices for most of our core products have been very low but this was largely offset by a higher exchange rate for the us dollar the improvement was due primarily to lower production costs and higher crude oil production mr egil myklebust president said hydro said the weak international economy and large exports from the former soviet union have depressed markets and continue to cause uncertainty particularly for light metals low crude oil prices and continuing structural problems in the european fertiliser industry also represent challenges it added group financial costs last year were cut to nkr1 94bn from nkr2 62bn a year earlier as foreign exchange losses fell sharply to nkr496m from nkr1 4bn for the group s core business segments agriculture swung to an operating profit of nkr481m in 1993 from a loss of nkr215m as sales rose by nkr1 5bn to nkr26 9bn the advance was due to significantly lower costs following two years of restructuring and higher sales volume in europe in 1992 hydro charged accounts with restructuring costs nkr160m but since 1991 costs have been cut by nkr922m far above a goal of nkr800m set by the company oil and gas boosted 1993 operating profit by nkr497m to nkr3 15bn as sales rose by nkr1 41bn to nkr14 1bn petroleum production increased by 1 1m tonnes of oil equivalent to 9 4m helped by two new fields being brought on stream light metals the only one of the group s divisions to suffer a setback saw operating profits fall nkr92m to nkr453m as sales rose nkr69m to nkr16 3bn weaker prices for primary aluminium and lower demand for aluminium extrusions were behind the decline

title: ft 22 feb 94 uk company news mam s pounds 5m for venture group
body: mercury asset management the fund management arm of sg warburg has bought grosvenor ventures the venture capital company featured in the 1992 bbc series the adventurers the move is the first outright purchase by one venture capital group of another but confirms a trend towards a consolidation within the industry as the raising of funds has become increasingly difficult in the uk mam is understood to have paid about pounds 5m for grosvenor ventures which manages grosvenor development capital and four limited partnerships and has investments of more than pounds 50m the grosvenor team will remain in the slough offices and will join mam s development capital arm which manages about pounds 400m of venture and development capital investments the sale has been expected within the industry since grosvenor failed to raise a new fund from investors and the departure of chairman mr robert drummond after a disagreement over the future direction of the company mam said grosvenor s business was complementary and that the new owner would discuss over the coming months the injection of new funds for grosvenor to manage they grosvenor have good access to a regional deal flow at the smaller end of the market for deals of pounds 750 000 up to pounds 2 5m which is what we want them to do said mam s ms sandra o neill mam will concentrate on larger buy outs from pounds 2 5m to pounds 30m the announcement of the sale came as grosvenor development capital the listed invested trust which is managed by grosvenor venture managers announced its best annual performance since it was listed in 1989 net assets increased by 31 per cent to pounds 15 5m in the year to 31 december 1993 and assets per share rose to 192 3p

title: ft 22 feb 94 uk company news kynoch rationalises after pounds 644 000 loss
body: kynoch group the specialist manufacturer of healthcare equipment swung from profits of pounds 958 000 to losses of pounds 644 000 pre tax for the year to december 31 turnover of continuing activities rose to pounds 14 3m pounds 13 3m there was also a pounds 226 000 contribution from acquisitions the group warned in september that profits for the year were likely to be well below those for 1992 for the opening six months they fell by 67 per cent to pounds 126 000 to stem the tide of losses the group has rationalised its mdh offshoot to give cost savings of pounds 423 000 in 1994 it has also sold its large capacity steriliser business which was the main cause of the 1993 deficit there were exceptional charges for non recurring items in 1993 amounting to pounds 249 000 nil losses per share emerged at 1 9p earnings 3 4p looking ahead mr john salkeld chairman said trading in recent months had stabilised and the pattern of demand had begun to improve from the low levels experienced in the second half of 1993 panmure gordon has agreed to become stockbroker to the group with immediate effect

title: ft 22 feb 94 uk company news new stores lift essex furniture
body: benefits of new store openings enabled essex furniture to raise pre tax profits by 14 per cent from pounds 619 000 to pounds 703 000 in the six months to december 31 sales at the usm quoted furniture retailer and manufacturer grew 44 per cent to pounds 7 47m mr michael franks chairman said trading from boxing day was ahead of forecast with excellent input from new locations results for the full year were expected to be very satisfactory he reported that the interim performance had exceeded budgeted forecasts and the company had absorbed the opening costs of a new head office and distribution facility of five new showrooms in the period an additional 60 000 sq ft had been added to selling space and the company said it intended to open a minimum of five showrooms in 1994 earnings advanced from 3 73p to 4 06p and the interim dividend is 1 8p 1 5p

title: ft 22 feb 94 uk company news a promise of no jam tomorrow a look at trafficmaster which is en route for a market quote
body: growing traffic congestion and offering customers a way of avoiding it are key elements in the strategy of a group which will soon come to the market with a capitalisation of about pounds 25m trafficmaster is a luton based company which claims to offer the world s first commercially available on board traffic monitoring system a dashboard mounted screen advises of upcoming traffic jams and road accidents in time for drivers to alter their route mr david martell chief executive said monday mornings were the worst time to travel on the uk s motorways while friday mornings were best in all parts of the country he said cynically i think this is because salesmen don t work on fridays they play golf trafficmaster has installed infra red sensors which monitor traffic speed transmit it by radio to a central computer and then feed the information to visual display units in subscribers vehicles the complete network is updated every three minutes and advises motorists of the average speed and direction of any hold up the system already covers more than 1 000 miles of motorways and trunk roads in the south of england and the midlands part of the flotation proceeds will be used to extend the network to cover the main motorways in england wales and scotland by the end of this year and main trunk roads during 1995 and 1996 trafficmaster units can be rented for pounds 30 a month or pounds 19 50 a month if purchased the screens currently cost pounds 199 but like other electronic products prices are likely to fall rapidly if and when they start being sold by high street retailers mr martell 45 is an accountant with interests in property and wine shipping he said the idea for trafficmaster came to him when sitting in an m25 traffic jam on the way to heathrow with an old school friend mr ian williams who is now a non executive director of the company they founded mr martell is a fan of motorways and believes some of the critical press coverage about them is undeserved however he was struck by the poor quality of information about traffic conditions available to drivers the company was established in 1988 and backed by hambro venture capital funds developed the necessary dedicated hardware and software a pilot scheme covering 250 miles of motorways around london was successfully concluded in 1992 after which the company was awarded a 12 year licence to operate the system on all english motorways and trunk roads the licence is non exclusive and mr martell acknowledges that other organisations might seek to enter the market however he believes the company s investment means it has a four year technological lead and a window of opportunity to market its product to date trafficmaster is still incurring trading losses but has installed about 2 000 screens it is close to break even at that level but further investment on extending the network will raise that hurdle however once the network is complete revenue from each additional subscriber should make profitability climb quickly trafficmaster said that existing subscribers which include mainly senior employees from 55 of the ft se 100 companies report that the system helps save time reduces frustration and provides insurance against delay there seems little danger of diminishing demand the confederation of british industry estimates that traffic congestion now costs the uk pounds 15bn a year according to department of transport forecasts the number of vehicles in the uk will grow by 60 per cent by 2020 and road usage will more than double in the same period trafficmaster has patents pending in 48 countries in the us where trafficmaster is a registered trade mark westinghouse electric the us conglomerate has signed an exclusive agreement to introduce the system probably starting on washington dc s beltway about 20 per cent of current subscribers pay extra to use the system as a personal pager a new generation of screens will use smart card technology to provide extra services such as demonstrating each user s position and sending local information and routing from motorway sites so far the company has installed giant trafficmaster screens at 20 welcome break motorway sites with plans for 25 more at ports and airports this year each site can generate more than pounds 18 000 from advertising and also acts as a strong marketing tool to potential subscribers the screens have also been installed in the reception area of several corporate customers so staff can check road conditions the company s big breakthrough to the mass market could come when motor manufacturers start providing guidance systems in new vehicles renault and bmw are among the car manufacturers working along these lines trafficmaster will be floated by way of a placing sponsored by allied provincial to raise about pounds 5m of new money peek the quoted electronics group currently has a 23 per cent stake in the company but is not expected to sell any of its shares

title: ft 22 feb 94 uk company news sheffield insulations pounds 1 2m purchase
body: sheffield insulations is to buy turton ventures a distributor of safety and workwear clothing products for pounds 1 2m the consideration will be satisfied by a payment of pounds 642 500 cash on completion and pounds 557 500 by the issue of 202 727 ordinary shares turton imports many of its products from east asia wong shi sheffield s taiwan based subsidiary will act as the procurement agent for the enlarged turton business

title: ft 22 feb 94 uk company news merrydown shares lose sparkle after warning on profits
body: shares of merrydown tumbled yesterday after the sussex based cider and soft drinks maker issued a warning on profits and announced plans to restructure its activities the shares were marked down to 125p in pre market dealings as analysts hastily revised their profits forecasts downwards before rallying to finish at 159p still 54p below friday s closing level the board chaired by mr richard purdey said that sales in the crucial christmas period had been very disappointing despite growth from the repackaged original brand the sales outcome for the full year to end march was likely to be well below previous expectations with a considerable adverse effect on profitability while the recently acquired shloer and plj brands had maintained sales cider was hit particularly in the bulk cash and carry and wholesale sectors reflecting competition from economy brands the directors said the full year was unlikely to show more than a modest profit and the level of the final dividend 6p last time for a total of 7p was under review the proposed restructuring aimed at increasing working capital by concentrating on the company s main brands would involve a reduction in stock levels and overheads and the disposal of martlet natural foods and other non core assets merrydown s quoted competitors hp bulmer and taunton cider both responded to the statement bulmer which produces the strongbow woodpecker and scrumpy jack brands described its trading over christmas as reasonable it said its brand portfolio was more balanced than merrydown s and stressed that economy brands accounted for just 5 to 6 per cent of the total cider market taunton which warned in december that lower priced brands had adversely affected the take home market said its own trading over the period was satisfactory the group which makes dry blackthorn and autumn gold and the premium red rock diamond white and brody brands is launching fresh promotional campaigns from next month but declined to make a formal statement on trading

title: ft 22 feb 94 uk company news all round growth helps ashtead leap to pounds 3 3m
body: ashtead the plant and machinery hire group which had a pounds 20 4m rights issue in november more than doubled pre tax profits from pounds 1 61m to pounds 3 26m in the six months to october 31 although the shares fell 12p to 439p yesterday they have been rising sharply from the 378p level of a fortnight ago with organic growth coming from all three divisions mr peter lewis chairman said that operational gearing of the business underpinned by maintained and even increased investment across the group throughout the recession lay behind the sharp profits rise during the period capital expenditure rose to pounds 6 5m pounds 5 3m and is expected to be pounds 8 5m pounds 4m in the second half group turnover advanced 24 per cent to pounds 20 9m pounds 16 8m with volumes up 24 per cent mr lewis said that further volume growth was the short term aim though there had been sporadic price increases of between 2 and 3 per cent on some lines since last spring a plant the core uk plant hire business raised operating profits to pounds 2 63m pounds 1 47m on turnover of pounds 15 9m pounds 13 4m ashtead technology the offshore services division lifted profits to pounds 603 000 pounds 489 000 on turnover lower at pounds 2 23m pounds 2 37m after the withdrawal from low margin sales programmes a singapore branch was opened in january sunbelt the us plant hire side increased profits six times to pounds 442 000 pounds 74 000 on turnover of pounds 2 73m pounds 1 1m this year it is spending pounds 1 3m on plant next year the figure will be pounds 3m earnings per share more than doubled from 5 2p to 10 9p and the interim dividend is raised to 1 3p 1 133p comment at this stage in its development ashtead leaves the cynic clutching at non existent straws there will be fewer billings days in the second half 115 against the first half s 129 so volume growth will ease slightly but even if prices don t firm as they are half expected to that will hardly dent the group s progress as apart from anything else interest charges will fall as the rights pounds 8m cash pile offsets previous borrowings the management has steered the group through the recession admirably investing heavily not rushing at fences in the us using profit sharing schemes well and they can afford to look a little smug with pounds 5 5m pre tax pencilled in giving earnings of about 16 5p the p e is 26 5 with no profits decelaration likely at least until 1997 the shares are worth staying with

title: ft 22 feb 94 uk company news smirnoff aims at kazak market
body: grand metropolitan has formed a joint venture to market smirnoff vodka in the former soviet republic of kazakhstan having seen dramatic growth in smirnoff sales in russia grandmet s idv spirits arm is now keen to attack the kazak vodka market which is 40 per cent bigger than the uk mr paul curtis idv s head of international marketing said kazakhstan represents another great opportunity for developing the strength of idv s international brands in emerging markets we are uniquely positioned with smirnoff which is already available and well known in some of the major cities he said there was also potential for idv s other brands which include j b rare scotch whisky idv which recently secured us distribution rights to stolichnaya russian vodka has been marketing us made smirnoff in russia since 1989 last year it sold 600 000 cases in russia compared with just 10 000 cases in 1991 in june the pierre smirnoff company set up its own office in moscow the new kazakhstan company called idv central asia is a joint venture with coromin inc an importer and marketing company with warehousing and transport facilities unilever has acquired 90 per cent of the shares in severnoye siyaniye a st petersburg based producer of lotions after shaves and colour cosmetics

title: ft 22 feb 94 uk company news wills ahead
body: wills group the distributor of fluid handling equipment reported doubled pre tax profits of pounds 575 000 for the six months to january 1 against pounds 287 000 the result was achieved on turnover up 44 per cent from pounds 8m to pounds 11 5m wills also announced a further acquisition with the purchase of cellar services technology a manchester based supplier to the brewing industry for pounds 60 000 in the year to may 31 it made pre tax profits of pounds 64 000 on turnover of pounds 1 5m the figures were the first to include a full contribution from platon acquired in april last year at the beginning of november srl based in lyon was acquired helping the french activities to show a good performance in italy buoyant results in some areas balanced downturns inothers trading in germany and the netherlands was poor while in the uk there has been some sign of improving market conditions but this has yet to show through in significant increases in demand earnings per share improved to 0 36p 0 28p basic or 0 35p 0 24p fully diluted the interim dividend is raised from 0 1p to 0 115p

title: ft 22 feb 94 uk company news rights and issues
body: net asset value per capital share at rights and issues investment trust advanced from 392 5p to 545 7p over the 12 months to december 31 net revenue rose to pounds 410 499 pounds 339 674 for earnings per income share of 10 177p 7 737p a final dividend of 6 3p makes an increased total of 8 7p 8 3p

title: ft 22 feb 94 uk company news bullough restates after shortfall
body: bullough the office products and refrigeration group has been forced to restate its full year results following the discovery of a pounds 1 4m shortfall in the assets of a subsidiary as a result the group yesterday reported restated audited pre tax profits of pounds 7 78m for the year to october 31 and earnings per share of 2 29p the shares closed 12p lower at 161p the shortfall was discovered in one of the branches of the group s general refrigeration business investigations are under way to determine the exact nature of the loss however the company said that until the investigation was completed it was not known how much of the loss was represented by the misappropriation of assets nor how much might be recovered from insurers a member of the branch accounting staff had been dismissed

title: ft 22 feb 94 uk company news city merchants high yield up 38
body: city merchants high yield trust saw its net asset value per share rise by 38 per cent from 105 7p to 146 2p over the 12 months to end december net revenue improved from pounds 1 46m to pounds 1 55m earnings per share on capital increased by last summer s successful placing dipped to 9 746p 9 02p a recommended final dividend of 2 4p brings the total distribution for the year to 8 4p

title: ft 22 feb 94 uk company news london industrial downturn
body: london industrial the property investment group which came to the market in december reported a fall in pre tax profits from pounds 363 200 to pounds 182 200 for the quarter to december 31 bringing the total for the nine months to pounds 537 200 against pounds 799 700 turnover on continuing operations improved to pounds 1 71m pounds 1 52m for the three months earnings per share were reduced to 2 1p 6 3p in addition to five acquisitions during the period an industrial estate was bought for pounds 164 000 from the london borough of southwark

title: ft 22 feb 94 uk company news quality software in us link up venture gives distribution access to 45 000 prospective customers
body: quality software products the gateshead based accounting software company which joined the main market last year has secured distribution in north america for its principal product through an innovative revenue sharing venture the deal has been signed with global software a us accounting software house based in raleigh north carolina the venture gives qsp access to 45 000 prospective customers the uk market for large scale accounting software is only about 3 000 customers at no cost it gives qsp a 5 per cent equity stake in global with the option to purchase a further 5 per cent at a later date qsp and global will share both software licence fee and maintenance revenues from qsp s new client server accounting software universal olas analysts were enthusiastic about the deal arguing that it provided qsp with a low cost and low risk method of entry to the us market sales in the north american market are critical for any software company with global ambitions but uk companies have a poor record of success in the us qsp s share price was unchanged yesterday at 407p mr alan mordain qsp chairman said the company had been seeking a suitable us partner for two years and had been encouraged by the similarity of approach between the two companies the global management which recently bought the company from hathaway corporation had powerful incentives to make the relationship work he said qsp has been successful in the uk with a mainframe accounting package but is pinning its future hopes on universal olas developed for client server systems at a cost of some pounds 12m client server systems are increasingly taking over from mainframe computers in large companies and could represent half of all installed systems by 1998 global with revenues of dollars 25m pounds 17m in 1993 and over 1 000 customers in the us including federal express and the american hospital association is a competitor to dun bradstreet software and computer associates of the us and sap of germany in mainframe software but has no client server software mr thomas roberg global s vice president said that without the qsp deal the company would have had to develop its own client server product qsp now has 10 customers for universal olas and has completed all the principal modules

title: ft 22 feb 94 uk company news prior makes second cash call
body: hanson s beazer estates subsidiary is taking a 3 5 per cent stake in prior the property group and architectural ironmonger as part consideration for the sale of two properties in hull and liverpool beazer which has given prior an option on a further property has undertaken not to sell the shares for at least 12 months prior is also buying bouverie house in london s fleet street for pounds 11 5m from a company controlled by the family trust of prior s chairman mr james prior it is seeking pounds 4 55m net through the placing of 108 3m shares at 4 1 2 p they are being made available to shareholders on 3 for 4 basis the shares were suspended last week at 7 1 4 p the company also announced pre tax profits of pounds 2 02m losses pounds 467 000 for the six months to september 30 as a result of the placing in may which raised pounds 2 37m net allowing a release of bank indebtedness of pounds 2 05m turnover was pounds 609 000 pounds 596 000 prior is buying the three properties for an aggregate pounds 12 7m satisfied by the issue of 32 2m shares pounds 2 28m cash and a loan of pounds 9m from century life which has also been granted an option for up to 4m shares at 4 1 2p

title: ft 22 feb 94 uk company news growth at johnson fry utilities

title: ft 22 feb 94 uk company news record orders for bp energy

title: ft 22 feb 94 international company news countyglen appoints two new directors
body: countyglen the dublin based property investor has appointed ms sara sharpe with 20 years experience in the financial sector of the us and mr daniel hardie a canadian with 25 years experience in the investment business to its main board ms sharpe and others intend to initiate proceedings both in ireland and the us against a number of parties including mr clayton love a director of countyglen countyglen has agreed to be joined as a plaintiff in the intended actions as a result mr clayton love has been suspended pending the outcome of the court proceedings

title: ft 22 feb 94 uk company news costs and squeezed margins hit fii
body: fii the shoe manufacturer which supplies marks and spencer yesterday announced a drop in interim pre tax profits from pounds 3 48m to pounds 551 000 the fall was due to a squeeze on margins and a series of one off costs in the science and footwear divisions the interim dividend is maintained at 6p as forecast in november s profits warning earnings fell from 15 3p to 2 2p per share turnover was 2 per cent higher at pounds 42m mr monty sumray chairman said that was largely due to fii s increased share of the uk footwear market sales in that division rose by 8 per cent to pounds 38m in a stagnant market he said pre tax profits in the division were affected by a pounds 44 000 exceptional cost of recalling a defective shoe design and rationalisation charges profits fell by pounds 1 4m to pounds 1 5m the shoe business continued to suffer from tight margins mr sumray said and there were indications that leather prices were likely to increase on the brighter side the recent decision by the european union to impose quotas on chinese shoe imports may help our cause said mr sumray the science division incurred costs of pounds 650 000 following the cancellation of a development contract and a product recall during the first half this resulted in a pounds 1 2m pre tax loss against a profit of pounds 200 000 last time

title: ft 22 feb 94 uk company news govett rises 21 to dollars 54 6m
body: govett the fund management and insurance group reported a 21 per cent increase in pre tax profits to dollars 54 6m pounds 37 3m for the year to december 31 profits growth came largely from fund management fees and investments after a good year for international equity and bond markets the us profile of the group which has half its assets and employees in the uk and half in the us has been helped by gaining a nasdaq listing last year it is seeking a new york stock exchange adr listing funds under management grew by 31 per cent to dollars 8 5bn but a large portion of the dollars 2bn increase is attributable to the acquisition of north american trust company last august which has dollars 1 5bn under management other inflows came from four large new us institutional accounts new investment funds and sales of us mutual funds weekly sales of us mutual funds leapt from dollars 250 000 to dollars 10m and mr ian whitehead chief financial officer said that growth was expected to continue this year the group is aiming to increase the us mutual fund business from dollars 340m to dollars 1bn in the near term govett has benefited from us investors general move to international markets driven by low interest rates and poor prospects for us stocks income from fund management improved to dollars 19 6m dollars 15 4m and investment income almost doubled to dollars 18 5m dollars 9 7m the contribution from the us life assurance and annuities arm slipped to dollars 18 3m dollars 19m but mr whitehead said this did not reflect significant unrealised gains income from development capital dropped to dollars 4 5m dollars 7m a share buy back programme contributed to the improved fully diluted earnings per share figure up 38 per cent to 62 1 cents there is a final gross dividend of 18 cents 14 5 cents to make a total of 28 cents 24 cents

title: ft 22 feb 94 uk company news low bonar jumps to pounds 32m near fourfold advance helped by restructuring and new subsidiaries
body: low bonar yesterday announced a near fourfold increase in profits as the packaging and plastics group reaped the benefits of a wide ranging restructuring and contributions from new subsidiaries britain s self proclaimed market leader in food packaging saw pre tax profits climb from pounds 8 1m to pounds 31 6m in the 12 months to november 30 last year although the 1992 figures were distorted by heavy reorganisation costs in north america and the closure of its uk non wovens business profits before exceptionals showed a 43 per cent improvement mr jim leng chief executive said the group which wraps products as diversified as soap and silage was now in a dominant position as manufacturers consolidated orders with a few key suppliers we ve got rid of the bits and pieces which were not central and we now want to grow in our main businesses particularly in north america and europe he added of the group s three core areas packaging showed the sharpest improvement with a 55 4 per cent increase in profits to pounds 20m the division representing more than half of group profit was boosted by contributions of pounds 5 3m from its latest acquisitions cereal packaging purchased from kellogg for pounds 33 5m and designer cmb carton systems the packaging equipment company acquired for pounds 17 4m the acquisitions funded by a pounds 50 2m rights issue last april contributed pounds 36m to group turnover of pounds 368 9m pounds 307 3m sales of specialist materials improved by 15 per cent to pounds 82 8m with profits ahead 35 per cent at pounds 13m pounds 9 6m the input however of the plastics division was more modest turnover increased 6 5 per cent to pounds 52 8m while profits rose 4 5 per cent to pounds 4 84m mr norman mcleod finance director said the division had failed to keep pace with the other sectors because of the recession in continental europe where profits fell to pounds 2 7m pounds 3 8m nevertheless we still managed to generate pounds 25m in cash during the year and brought gearing down to 8 per cent from 30 per cent he added earnings per share rose 31 per cent to 21 77p compared with 16 56p before exceptionals in 1992 a proposed final dividend of 7 1p lifts the total to 10p a 10 per cent increase comment low bonar has begun to make its assets sweat having introduced new management and completed disposals in the uk and north america it has improved productivity sharply and cut borrowing a five year contract with kellogg has also insulated it from the worst effects of supermarket price cuts with orders stabilising in europe and only a 25 per cent exposure to the consumer packaging business profits are expected to exceed pounds 39m this year on a forward earnings multiple of 16 the shares up 7p at 407p yesterday appear inexpensive

title: ft 22 feb 94 uk company news odds shorten on racecourse win
body: racecourse holdings trust owned by the jockey club remains the favourite to win the race to own epsom home of the derby but yesterday mr stan clarke who has turned round uttoxeter racecourse from losses five years ago confirmed that he was putting in a private bid along with mr anthony solomons chairman of singer friedlander the merchant banking and property group and mr andrew cohen managing director of betterware the home shopping company also in the running is sunset vine which makes sports television programmes epsom is being sold along with sandown park and kempton park by the horserace betting levy board the statutory body that acquired the courses more than 20 years ago in order to protect them from possible property development all three courses lie within the m25 london s outer ring road estimates of their total value run up to pounds 30m the bids must be submitted to lazard brothers the merchant bank handling the sale by the end of this week the winner is expected to be announced at the end of march at the earliest peninsular oriental steam navigation the shipping and property company which was also shortlisted said that it would not be submitting a bid also out of the running is the racehorse owners association which feels aggrieved that it did not make the final list the association which has 4 500 members is thought to have put in an indicative bid of well over pounds 20m last month mr david hillyard managing director of racecourse holdings trust said his group had a good track record for managing large racecourses the trust owns nine including cheltenham and newmarket and ploughs all its profits back into racing mr clarke owner of uttoxeter said he had served his apprenticeship in racing over the past five years turning the course from losses of pounds 36 000 in 1989 to pounds 400 000 profits this year we are committed racing men said mr clarke who sold his housebuilding business for pounds 51m in 1986 he believes he can transfer to racing the management expertise learnt in building up two businesses mr gerry buckland of sunset vine said the company specialised in sports and horse racing television programmes and believed it could use its skills to enhance the potential of the three courses the derby has not had the crack of the whip it might have had he said meanwhile mr bill gredley chairman of the racehorse owners association feels that the association s bid was unfairly dismissed its committee which included mr david sieff of marks and spencer and sir eric parker former chief executive of trafalgar house felt the bid timetable squeezed between christmas and march 1 was too tight nevertheless we put in a very competitive bid and we feel that we need some answers mr gredley stated

title: ft 22 feb 94 rover and honda going their own ways co operation on an ad hoc basis
body: mr john bacchus rover s head of collaborative strategy was in tokyo yesterday seeing the corporate umbrella over his honda projects snatched out of his hands he has been rover s point of contact with honda as the two companies worked together over new models and fostered co operative manufacturing although rover and honda exchanged board members the arrangements for collaboration under that level were loose rover never had a group of people who spent all their time collaborating with honda the role of mr bacchus was to facilitate contacts whenever they were needed and he has been making about 18 trips to japan every year to that end another frequent visitor to tokyo has been mr alan curtis managing director of product supply at rover and responsible for bringing new models to market but neither side ever had a permanent presence in the plants or offices of the other at working level the rover and honda executives who came into contact most frequently were the designers and engineers rover formed teams to undertake projects and tasks when the work was complete the team would be dissolved its members moving on to something else practically the collaboration of the two companies was done on an ad hoc basis as the need arose interface at any level as rover put it yesterday as an example rover designers spent considerable time in tokyo when they were developing the 600 model the changes in rover s manufacturing processes over the last 15 years have been helped by a running series of visits to honda factories but executives learned more from the honda plants in the us than they did from those in japan in the us you could see how the japanese adapted to western structures rover explained the contacts have resulted in a growing network of executives across the two companies accustomed to co operating with each other which has so far been unaffected by the bmw purchase many friendships will continue regardless said one rover executive

title: ft 22 feb 94 rover and honda going their own ways few fears over other link ups
body: fears that the breakdown of rover s relationship with honda could harm other anglo japanese joint ventures were played down yesterday by one of the few other companies to enjoy a cross shareholding in a japanese corporation allied lyons the drinks food and retailing group said it did not expect the rover affair to have a significant affect on its links with suntory japan s largest whisky distiller and one of the country s biggest private companies since 1989 allied lyons has been able to take advantage of a 1 per cent holding in the privately owned company to distribute its alcohol products in the fiercely competitive japanese market in turn suntory has taken a 4 3 per stake in allied lyons worth about pounds 230m at yesterday s market price under the 40 year joint venture agreement signed in 1989 the two groups agreed to set up distribution and marketing companies in japan allied lyons owns 51 per cent of the distribution group and 49 per cent of the marketing company with suntory holding the remainder the osaka based group sells allied lyons products in its home market while the uk company distributes some suntory products in north america such links are rare because japanese companies have usually opted for outright control in the uk often starting from greenfield sites toyota and nissan have built their own car plants for example these investors may feel vindicated after the treatment meted out to honda but fears of a backlash against japanese investment in the uk seems unlikely given the japanese preference for local ownership most importantly they regard the uk as a vital manufacturing base to break into european markets it is unthinkable therefore that they might run away at the first hint of trouble the priority given by japanese companies to employee and trading relationships with component suppliers has meant that a lot of time and money has been committed during the last decade to establishing a large presence in the uk in fact the commitment in many areas is deepening as japanese manufacturers have gone beyond seeing the uk simply as a cheap production country and a way to avoid trade friction when selling into european union markets komatsu the construction equipment producer manufactures hydraulic excavators for the european market from its factory in birtley near newcastle when the plant began production in 1987 it was producing machines to japanese designs it now has its own uk design team making birtley the first komatsu overseas plant to manufacture non japanese designed models yamazaki the world s largest producer of computer controlled machine tools also began manufacturing in the uk in 1987 supplying european markets the range of products built at the worcester plant is now being expanded to serve world markets instead of just europe an example of high yen effect is nsk bearings in peterlee county durham which recently secured its first orders from east asia supplying bearings to white goods manufacturers in china and indonesia these previously had been supplied by nsk s parent in japan japanese property and construction companies which also established wholly owned operations in the uk have fared less well companies like kumagai which bought expensively at the peak of the property market in the late 1980 are now seeking to retrench but this is for reasons other than a breakdown of relationships with british partners as in the case of honda and rover

title: ft 22 feb 94 rover and honda going their own ways capable of producing from the ground up the loss of its japanese partner does not necessarily present a significant setback for the uk carmaker
body: a critical question faces rover group how will it survive without honda s technology and expertise in the wake of their failed relationship rover has 2 000 design development and engineering staff it has the capability to take a car from first concept on a computer screen to production with no outside help this capability includes the design development and production of engines and gearboxes senior rover executives insist that this capability has not been utilised to the full during the period of rover s 15 year partnership with honda for straightforward commercial reasons rather than for any lack of technical ability there is no logic they maintain in rover developing wholly separate vehicles or powertrains for market slots that can be occupied perfectly adequately by shared development models enjoying good economies of scale and rover s full technical capability will in any case be amply demonstrated in new as yet secret models already scheduled for production and in which honda has played no part according to mr john towers rover s chief executive that such core expertise has been retained by rover is easily overlooked however given that the uk car maker being sold to bmw appears to have been so overwhelmingly dependent on honda two of rover s key model ranges the 600 and 200 400 saloons are the subject of simple licensing agreements with honda or are joint developments while a key rover gearbox is also a honda design made under licence all the licence agreements can be terminated by honda at three months notice mr bernd pischetsrieder bmw s chairman has indicated that bmw will be more than willing to place some of bmw s own 6 000 engineers at rover s disposal as future new model plans develop without honda 6 000 bmw engineers i don t know what we d do with them said one rover executive yesterday we are fully capable of seeing through our new car projects where rover executives and engineers many of whom regret the loss of honda as a long term partner do see major benefits in bmw s ownership is in the finan cial resources that they expect to be made avail able currently rover spends some pounds 200m a year on new model development bringing cars into production and upgrading or maintaining plant and equipment to build them this is a very small amount by mainstream motor industry standards and mr pischetsrieder has indicated that he would expect to see rover increase it to at least 7 per cent of its pounds 4 3bn of annual sales or slightly more than pounds 300m a year that would give rover the ability to bring to fruition various new model ideas which have been beyond its financial grasp all car makers have more model ideas than finance and so have to prioritise what is actually built the company said yesterday rover s design research development and engineering facilities are more extensive than many realise they are concentrated at canley near birmingham and at a vast 900 acre complex including 26 miles of test track at gaydon in warwickshire the gaydon facility currently employing 900 engineers and the subject of a pounds 100m plus new building programme includes climatic wind tunnels prototype build centre structural analysis facilities electro magnetic compatibility centre to test car computer and wiring systems component test laboratories noise vibration and harshness analysis centre engine test beds and anechoic sound free chambers it contains within it the capability to develop engines from scratch it is where rover s state of the art k series multi valve engine was developed and which in turn is being developed from a small capacity four cylinder unit into a full range of engines including a v6 capable of powering almost any vehicle rover might make in the future commercial logic once again dictates however that bmw and other manufacturers units are used instead in some applications such as diesels where they can be simply taken off the shelf peugeot diesels for example are used in rover 200 400 and metro ranges the canley centre is occupied by some 1 000 designers and engineers where vehicles are styled from scratch and where a master database of dimensions and other elements is created off which rover s and component suppliers project engineers can work however one of the most valuable benefits rover has gained from its long relationship with honda has been how to break down old barriers between the various development departments and use simultaneous engineering to bring products to market more quickly and with many fewer mistakes in the build up to production honda has changed rover s methodology radically to the extent that new vehicle projects are not even centred at gardon or canley but at the plant where they are to be built for the 600 for example a project leader was appointed at the cowley manufacturing plant he appointed a team and they lived within just one room while ideas for the car took shape gaydon and canley personnel simply became part of the project team it is this honda taught approach to development costs and quality which allowed rover to take its discovery four wheel drive model into production in a record breaking 21 months and is where rover executives acknowledge rover s greatest debt to honda lies understandably perhaps honda is not anxious to see it all handed to such a fierce rival on a plate rover and honda the main links type of agreement example status equity honda has 20 stake in rover honda selling to bmw holdings cars rover has 20 stake in honda bmw selling to honda uk licensing honda car designs can be broken on 3 months rover 200 400 600 and 800 notice honda to negotiate with bmw honda component designs as above eg gearbox for 2 litre rover engines honda has supplied production rover able to maintain equipment and technology to existing equipment rover for eg its 200 400 and 600 models component rover and honda each sell the in many cases each party supplies other about pounds 400m worth has to supply the other of car parts a year as long as the car model eg honda sells to rover 1 6 remains in production 2 0 2 3 and 2 7 litre engines fascias for 600 models rover sells body panels to honda for uk made accords maintenance of common lists of disintegration of this parts specifications and relationship would quickly suppliers cause chaos on production lines vehicle rover makes honda concertos model sales likely to sales in birmingham and supplies continue land rover discoveries for sale as honda crossroads in japan

title: ft 22 feb 94 rover and honda going their own ways government comes under pressure to intervene
body: the government was yesterday under pressure from some of its own backbenchers to encourage honda to continue its collaboration with rover angry calls for intervention from tory mps are likely to dismay ministers who only a few weeks ago were privately expressing relief that rover s sale to bmw had not caused a political row sir teddy taylor southend east said honda has been treated shamefully a minister should now make a public statement saying the government regrets the way the sale of rover to bmw has been handled to alleviate the problem another senior backbencher said the department of trade and industry should start batting for britain by encouraging the japanese to guarantee a long term working relationship with rover however downing street dismissed calls for intervention arguing that it was not a matter for the prime minister it was made clear that mr john major hopes that co operation will continue between honda and rover but does not share the apocalyptic vision of those who fear a speedy end to the relationship however mr simon coombs swindon warned that a decision by honda to sever all its links with rover could prove very damaging although honda stressed that the 2 000 jobs at its plant in swindon would not be affected by its decision to sell its 20 per cent rover stake mr coombs said an end to joint contracts would affect many of his constituents reliant on honda he has already asked mr tim sainsbury industry minister to find out why there was no british company interested in buying the country s last car volume manufacturer there is deep unease among backbenchers that honda s decision to sell its stake in rover could herald the end of the relationship between the two companies there is also concern that it could harm britain s chances of continuing to receive the biggest share of japanese inward investment in europe the uk accounts for 40 per cent of all japanese european investment according to government figures we now know that honda are deeply distressed said sir teddy if its not to have an affect on japanese inward investment the government must make a statement mr robin cook labour s shadow trade and industry spokesman called on ministers to live up to their promise that rover and its workforce would not suffer from the bmw takeover the danger for rover is that customers will lose confidence and the workforce will lose morale if the uncertainty is not ended swiftly he said

title: ft 22 feb 94 bond markets rattled by us and germany
body: europe s bond markets took another tumble yesterday rattled by strike threats from germany s largest trade union and by the possibility of further us monetary tightening dealers said most of the selling came from professional traders in the futures markets while investors were reported to have remained on the sidelines although us markets were closed for a national holiday traders reported continued selling by us hedge funds albeit at a less frantic pace than late last week hedge funds private pools of highly leveraged funds were big buyers of european bonds last year and have recently been reported to be liquidating their holdings german government bonds dropped by almost a point after the country s powerful engineering union ig metall said it had called a strike vote in lower saxony fears that a strike would be approved and spread to other parts of northern germany were used as an excuse for further selling amid bearish sentiment the sell off of european bonds began earlier this month when the us federal reserve raised interest rates despite last week s round of european interest rate cuts bond markets remain dogged by fears that the end of the global rally has come it s a case of the end of cycle blues said mr graham mcdevitt bond strategist at market analysis firm idea uk gilts fell by more than a point dragged down by their european counterparts the long gilt futures contract on liffe dropped by 1 3 32 points to close at 114 1 2 having recovered from an earlier low of 114 in the uk equity market the ft se 100 index fell 32 3 to 3 350 3 with losses intensified in late trading after reports of the german strike talks although trading was subdued by the holiday closure in new york the london market found difficulty in holding on to the important 3 350 benchmark which was briefly lost just before the close of business hopes that domestic interest rates can still be cut remained solid at first but were bruised later when bond prices weakened afresh other european equity markets eased under the pressure of falling bond markets and fears of a further decline in wall street later today in germany the dax index of the 30 most widely traded stocks fell 1 5 per cent while in france the cac 40 index slipped 1 6 per cent today the markets will be listening out for the comments made by mr alan greenspan chairman of the us federal reserve to congress lex page 22 london se page 42 world stock markets page 39

title: ft 22 feb 94 british land buys into stanhope george soros and john ritblat have moved to gain control of the broadgate centre
body: british land has acquired 29 9 per cent of the property company stanhope in a deal aimed at giving mr john ritblat and mr george soros control of the prestigious office development at broadgate in the city of london the share price of stanhope rose 14p or 50 per cent to 42p on the announcement the stanhope stake will be transferred to the pounds 500m british land quantum property investment fund the joint venture formed last june between british land and mr soros the us investor who made massive profits betting against sterling in the 1992 currency crisis british land hopes to implement a financial restructuring which would leave the fund with 100 per cent of the broadgate centre and the ludgate office development in the city which are valued at close to pounds 1bn and leave stanhope as an independently managed company stanhope announced in november that it was considering ways to strengthen its balance sheet in june 1993 it had negative net worth of pounds 15 8m and its rental income has remained insufficient to cover its debt financing and overheads stanhope s main asset is its half share in the broadgate development next to london s liverpool street station which cost pounds 2bn to build and still carries pounds 800m debt stanhope also holds pre emption rights over the remaining stake which is in the hands of the receivers at rosehaugh which collapsed in december 1992 the company responded to the announcement with a statement that it intended to begin discussions with british land to seek clarification of its proposals for stanhope stanhope which has been working on restructuring plans has been unenthusiastic about the prospect of selling off its prize assets in their entirety it said it would continue to assess on their merits all the alternatives available to stanhope including any proposal which british land may make mr ritblat british land s chairman said the best case scenario would that we take out the broadgate and ludgate complexes from stanhope and the receivers and we so organise it that stanhope is solvent and able to return to doing what it does best he wanted stanhope to remain independent and british land would not request board representation the stanhope shares were part of olympia york s 33 per cent stake which was taken on by the bank of nova scotia british land is paying pounds 1 64m cash and issuing 753 562 new shares at 440 5p valuing the deal at pounds 4 96m compared with the pounds 124m paid by o y in 1988 lex page 22

title: ft 22 feb 94 small price to pay for prime seat george soros and john ritblat have moved to gain control of the broadgate centre
body: the announcement that mr john ritblat s british land has bought a stake in stanhope a struggling developer has turned the spotlight on broadgate the city of london complex which is stanhope s main asset for a small outlay mr ritblat has won a seat at the negotiating table from which he intends to gain control of stanhope s broadgate assets the deal was greeted by analysts as a potentially important deal for british land it looks as though john ritblat is making sure that he either gets broadgate through the corporate route or that he has a ringside seat whenever it goes up for sale said mr chris turner director of research at barclays de zoete wedd securities this is potentially another big hit by british land says mr robert fowlds of kleinwort benson mr ritblat is paying a small amount for potentially a slice of a pounds 1bn property it is not yet clear whether stanhope will play according to mr ritblat s plans although its alternatives appear limited stanhope also appeared to query the validity of the stake acquisition by drawing attention to the pre emption rights belonging to mr stuart lipton stanhope s chief executive by which he would have first refusal on the shares that originally belonged to olympia york if british land succeeds in achieving its goal the prize could be a substantial one stanhope owns a half share of broadgate properties which owns six buildings in the broadgate development as well as the 600 000 sq ft ludgate development on the western edge of the city of london it also has pre emption rights over the other half which is controlled by the receivers of rosehaugh broadgate was one of the largest developments to be built in the 1980s at a ceremony during the building work in july 1986 lady thatcher the former prime minister described it as the largest development in the city since the great fire of london in 1666 the pounds 2bn development was successful in attracting the financial services industry as it expanded in the aftermath of 1986 s big bang its large buildings constructed to accommodate the computer cabling and air conditioning needed by large trading floors succeeded in persuading a workforce of some 20 000 to move to hitherto unfamiliar territory north east of the city broadgate and ludgate have been affected by falls in the london office market where values have fallen by two thirds from the peak of the market three years ago half of broadgate has been sold and the two are now worth about pounds 1bn broadgate was a remarkably ambitious scheme for two small companies carried out in partnership with the british rail property board it was conceived in 1983 by mr lipton and mr godfrey bradman both property entrepreneurs the key for such relatively insubstantial companies to build such a large development lay in the use of non recourse loans commonplace in the us but new to the uk these allowed the borrower to confine the security of the loan to specific assets rather than the parent company despite broadgate s success in attracting prestigious tenants it was not enough to cushion its developers from the downturn which hit the industry in 1990 rosehaugh was one of the first large property companies to signal the coming problems when it announced a pounds 125m rights issue in 1990 its losses continued to mount and in december 1992 the company was put into receivership stanhope has struggled on courtesy of its bankers its net assets fell from pounds 458m in 1990 to a minus pounds 15 8m in june 1993 asset values have started to appreciate again but the company has continued to suffer operating losses and its existence remains contingent on the approval of its bankers several months ago it began work on a pounds 160m restructuring plan which involved raising new funds and merging with its associate broadgate properties analysts expected to see some results last month but progress so far has been limited british land said yesterday that it intended to play a role in stanhope s restructuring plans mr ritblat said however that he was not interested in gaining control of stanhope or even in having board representation our objective is to ensure that stanhope remains independent he said we would not expect to play an active role in the company in his view the solution to stanhope s problems is to sell broadgate and ludgate and in the process offload the large debt they carry we want to stabilise stanhope and provide some some seed capital we know what we want to do he said
